Formula: Churned Customers / Total Customers at Period Start * 100
Interpretation: Percentage of customers lost in period

Formula: (Sales Spend + Marketing Spend) / New Customers Acquired
Interpretation: Total cost to acquire one new customer
Total revenue expected from a customer over their lifetime
Health of unit economics - value vs acquisition cost

Formula: (MRR Start + Expansion - Contraction - Churn) / MRR Start * 100
Interpretation: Revenue retained from existing customers including expansion
Months to recover customer acquisition cost
Percentage of trials that become paying customers

Good Benchmark: Varies by product - define activation first

Interpretation: How often users return - product habit

Formula: (New MRR + Expansion MRR) / (Churned MRR + Contraction MRR)
Interpretation: Growth efficiency - new vs lost revenue
Percentage of visits that result in purchase

Good Benchmark: Varies by industry - track trend over time

Interpretation: Percentage of shopping carts not completed
Cost to acquire one new customer
Total expected revenue from a customer
Percentage of customers who buy again
Average orders per customer per period

Good Benchmark: Track trend - combines traffic and conversion

Interpretation: How often inventory sells and is replaced
Good Benchmark: Higher is better - varies by category
Varies by industry - compare to peers

Formula: Net cash from core business operations

Good Benchmark: Depends on stage - 20%+ for growth companies

Interpretation: Cost to acquire a customer or lead
Percentage of visitors taking desired action
Percentage of leads that become customers

Good Benchmark: < 40% for content sites, < 60% for landing pages
Related Metrics: Time on Site, Pages per Session

Interpretation: Time spent on site per visit

Formula: Time from signup to first value moment
Good Benchmark: Shorter is better - define value moment
